result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence. Zero days credit for time served.

superMiscConds.notes: No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.

Pay costs, victim witness surcharges and penalty assessments. If defendant fails to pay the monetary amounts on time, a judgment will be entered against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can proceed under sec. 71.935 of the statutes as well as other collection procedures.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court ordered all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid.  Court ordered DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of (max 25%) of any amounts provided in Wis. Stats. section 973.05(4)(b), 303.01(8), and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. SPC
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (16 pages) commencing JULY 2, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 6 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 3 YEARS with credit for 0 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 3 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid.  Court ordered DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of (max 25%) of any amounts provided in Wis. Stats. section 973.05(4)(b), 303.01(8), and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Seek and maintain employment.
-  Pay costs, victim witness surcharges and penalty assessments.  If defendant fails to pay the monetary amounts on time, a judgment will be entered against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can proceed under sec. 71.935 of the statutes as well as other collection procedures.
-  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence & Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress proceeds.  Sworn-in for the State:  West Allis Police Sargent Michael Kenpinski; Exhibit #1 marked and identified; West Allis Police Sargent Clint Corwin; Exhibit #2 marked, identified.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds the officer had a reasonable and articulable suspicion to stop the vehicle and did have probable cause to arrest the defendant.  Court denies defense motion.  

Court rules on motions in limine.   Court orders witnesses sequestered for the jury trial.  Parties stipulate to prior convictions for defendant.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.

Court orders defendant to be produced for the next court date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Motions in Limnine received and filed./ds
State's Response to Motion Alleging an Illegal Stop received and filed./ds

Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 5-6-14; response by 5-20-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Suppress Illegal Stop received and filed./ds

Attorney Daniel E. Meylink in court, defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Meylink has been retained by the defendant and needs to obtain discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis E. Epps in court, defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant is in custody at the House of Correction on a VOP hold.  Attorney Epps needs to review discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Transcript (16 pages) PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT commencing 02/14/2014 received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #04CF210 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Michael Kempinski-West Allis Police Department Sargeant.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Jeffrey Ortiz Ortiz in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
